comment: Kennedy is tough but fair. He's also the only teacher for welding, so good luck. As long as you keep up on the Tooling-U and pay attention in class, and you'll do fine. His lab quizzes are kind of hard cause you have to remember everything he ever says during welding lab. He also LOVES group projects, so be sure to get a good group who aren't lazy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: If your an engineer and you need to learn real world engineering, HE IS THE GUY. He is extrememely tough and there were times I thought I was gonna fail, but he pushed me to work harder in quizzes and tests and I got better. Tough love kind of professor, but when I needed recommendations for my Co-op he provided them same day. HIGHLY RECCOMEND

will purposefully make things sound complicated by talking in a "professional engineering manner" instead of simplifying. Has said and I quote "it is not my job to teach you, i present data and you find a way to teach yourselves". So enjoy paying tuition just to not be taught. This is also a survey class, its like drinking water from a fire hydrant

Kennedy is a wonderful professor. That is all I can tell you. The reason I say "poor you" when I hear someone is in his graphics class is because I hate graphics. Kennedy himself made the class relevant to my major, made sure I knew the material, and made sure everyone was awake and ready to go for our 8 AM. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Really cool, fun to be in his class, gets to know his students, no nonsense, wants you to do your best. Heavy focus on preparing you for industry. Lots of time on homework is necessary, especially in the beginning (drafting on paper) before you get into Solidworks.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Kennedy will make you work hard, but will over-prepare you for the CSWA. I got a perfect score, and although there were tons of assignments, I would take him again for any class I can.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Great guy, strickt, passing this class all depends on how well you are at picking up new software

Took him for graphics 2. Overall an amazing professor. My proficiency with not only solidworks but design in general and my 100% CSWA score is because of him. He was willing to answer questions during office hours and mentor you in your school and career options. He even saw a internship that reminded him of me and sent me an email for it. Take him

Fantastic guy who engages with his students. Definitely knows his stuff. teaches to the industry, not to the standards. Learned things in this class other professor wouldn't go over. Lots of homework grades, but he drops the lowest 5 or so. Took him for graphics 1, so great I took graphics 2 just to have him again.

I found this class to be engaging and interesting even early in the morning. This professor cares a lot about students who show that they are interested in the material he teaches and will adjust the harshness of his grading to how well you do in the class. If you care about engineering graphics and aren't taking it for a filler spot I recommend it
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Very knowledgeable and experienced, but his class is very difficult. He moves fast and is hard to keep up with at times, but if you stick with it, you will know more than most other EDG1211 classes. You put in a lot of hours for the firs couple months, but it then tapers off near the end and becomes a pure Solidworks class, which his is king at.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Good teacher, very experienced, good sense of humor, is very willing to help if you need it. Be prepared for lots of homework during the first half of the semester, once you move to solidworks the homework basically disapears

Easygoing lectures and great at answering questions. My advice to you is to read ALL of the key vocab words before lecture so that when you go in to it you remember the words and their meanings better. The exams are no surprise, they just test you on your vocab knowledge. The math questions are rather simple, they felt like chem 1 type of problems.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Super tough grader. If you have one little mistake you will get B on that test, and he is not a good teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Occasionally rude but hilarious most of time. Bad teaching style, really tough grader, not recommend to take him. Take another professor to get a good grade.

DO NOT TAKE HIM IF YOU HAVE A CHANCE. He seems professional but it does not mean he is a good teacher. Minor quizzes are highly tough because he is a tough grader. Just don't take him if you want to get a better grade. I really regret I chose him.
Pros: Professional,  information is always related and relatively clear, experienced engineer.   Cons: Inappropriately rude occasionally, plays favorites, moderately impatient.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: very experienced engineer who knows what he's talking about. good guy who gives pretty good feedback but make sure you practice outside of class or concepts will be hard to grasp.

Really Good teacher, he try to relate to you and is really funny. You will have to learn how to draw but it will pay off in the long run and he teaches very cleanly. He is a professional engineer so he knows what he is talking about. He is willing to stay after class and help you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The beginning of the semester is filled with hand drawing, and this takes forever to complete. Once the class moves to solid works, it is easier. I do not understand why we had to hand draw assignments as we will always have computers at the ready. Get ready to work if you take this class. It is fun, but it is lots of work too. Cares about students
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK
